text: Hello everyone, I am Dory. I am an
English teacher and this is an
introductory video about the ILS exam.
So what exactly is ITS? IELTS stands for
international English language testing
system and this is what it actually
does. It assesses your knowledge of the
English language. There are two versions
of the test. The academic and the
general one. The academic is for those
who want to study abroad in an
English-sp speakaking country of course
either for undergraduate or for
post-graduate studies and the general
version of the test is for those who
want to um work abroad in an
English-speaking environment or in an
Englishspeaking country. As I said
assesses your knowledge of the English
language. So there is no failure pass at
least not in the traditional way.
Instead, there are bounce scores from
zero to nine, nine being the highest
that describe your English ability. Most
universities accept a 6.5 or higher for
undergraduate studies and a seven band
score or higher for uh post-graduate
studies. Again, it depends on the
university. So, before you take the
exam, you might want to check this out
for the university of your interest. As
far as the general version of the test
is concerned, uh again it depends on
what purpose you take the exam and uh
what kind of bans is required by those
who originally asked you to take the
exam. The test overall lasts for 2 hours
and 44 minutes and tests your listening,
reading, writing and speaking skills.
There's great likelihood that speaking
the speaking section will take place um
a different day but the other three
listening reading and writing will take
place the same day one after the other
in in this exact same order. Now
listening lasts for 30 minutes and it is
the same for both academic and general.
Reading lasts for 60 minutes and it's
not the same. In the academic version of
the test, reading is is a little bit
harder because it is for academic
purposes. Writing again as reading lasts
for 60 minutes and it is different. The
academic one is a little bit more
challenging. And speaking it's the same
for both. It lasts from uh 11 to 15
minutes. And you're going to have an
actual conversation with a qualified IEL
examiner. Well, that's pretty much it as
an introduction. There are going to be
more videos to follow in which I'm going
to focus in each section in detail in
order to help you prepare with the exam.
Actually, my aim is to help anyone who
wants to study by himself or herself who
wants to extra information, extra
guidance or extra help about ILts or
about English in general. I have added
some links down below which I find very
useful and very helpful and hopefully
you will find them too. I have also
added the ILTS band scale and what its
band score actually means. If you like
this video, please subscribe and
comment. Thank you very much for
watching. and good luck with the exam.
